main event: On May 22, 1952, multiple sightings of an unidentified aerial object over Stockton, California were reported by both civilians and military personnel. The object was described as a bright silver, rectangular shape, hovering at an estimated altitude of 30,000 feet before eventually fading away after a 25-minute observation period.
interesting points: The object was observed to stop at 10,000 feet before ascending to 20,000, 30,000, and 36,000 feet, displaying unusual behavior.
A civilian using a sextant estimated the object's altitude at 30,000 feet, indicating efforts to capture data on the UFO.
Radar tracks were obtained around 1200 hours but faded before detailed information could be obtained, suggesting an attempt to track the object using radar technology.

The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including a 1st Lt. in the Army Reserve, and reported to the Intelligence Division of the 159th Infantry Division, California National Guard, adding credibility to the sightings.
Despite efforts to investigate the sightings, the final assessment was inconclusive, and the results were negative, leaving the UFO sighting unexplained.
sighted object: bright silver, rectangular object hovering in the sky
witnesses: civilians, 1st Lt. in the Army Reserve, Intelligence Division of the 159th Infantry Division, California National Guard
photographs: no photographs included in the report
